main_definition: To adjust or modify the pitch of a musical instrument, voice, or sound to create harmony.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjusting the pitch of an instrument
meanings_and_examples.example: The musician carefully tuned her guitar before starting the performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Aligning one's behavior with a particular set of standards or expectations
meanings_and_examples.example: After attending a lecture on professionalism, he made an effort to tune his actions accordingly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make something conform to the requirements or specifications of another thing
meanings_and_examples.example: She had to tune her presentation skills to meet the company's expectations for public speaking.
The song has a catchy and uplifting tune that people can't help but sing along with.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To get someone to agree or cooperate by appealing to their vanity or self-interest
meanings_and_examples.example: He tried to tune his friend into supporting the new policy by highlighting its benefits for him personally.
